result.execSummary:
The defendant Deiontre A Pierce was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Exposing Genitals to Child, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 948.10(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
1.  Defendant is to abide by all rules and recommendations of the supervising agent.
2.  No Contact with ECK.  Forms of no contact include: in person, in writing, by telephone, by e-mail, or by any other forms of electronic communication, or through a third party intending to circumvent the no contact provision.
3.  Court grants expungement upon successful completion of probation.

records.addlTxt: Terminated - Regular, effective December 29, 2016
Petition and Stipulation to Waive Appearance and Order Extending Probation for Unpaid Court Obligations - 12 monts (07/21/2017)

1:14 p.m.  Defendant present in court without counsel.  Agent Deb Duel present in court.  Court questions defendant regarding payment of monies.  Statement by defendant.  Court finds the defendant has not made good faith effort and extends probation for 12 months.  Court informs defendant that if he does not have this paid off in the 12 months, court will fashion conditions to include jail time.  Court goes over right to counsel and how to obtain one.

Court adjourned at 1:17 p.m.
Probation review hearing on June 6, 2016 at 01:00 pm.

records.descr: Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt:
No Contact provision of bond has been cancelled.
43

2:16 p.m.  Defendant present in court with Atty Barb Privat.  Lisa Vanden Branden for the State of Wisconsin.  Court recites agreement - State will amend to misdemeanor Expose genitals to a child.  State concurs.  Atty Privat concurs.  Defendant concurs.  State moves to amend to the misdemeanor.  Court grants amendment.

Court goes over plea questionnaire with the defendant.  Court goes over constitutional rights with the defendant - defendant waives these rights.  Court goes over the elements of each offense.  Court instructs defendant of the maximum penalty.  Court instructs defendant regarding deportation. 

Defendant enters a plea of NO CONTEST.  Court finds the plea is made freely, voluntarily, intelligently and understandingly.  Court finds there is a factual basis to support the plea.  Court finds the defendant guilty to count 1 as amended.  Court orders the judgment of conviction be entered here today.  ADA confirms compliance with victim witness rights.  Sentencing statement by DA.  Sentencing statement by Atty Privat.  No statement by the defendant.

Court sentences the defendant to:  SWD, and places the defendant on probation for 12 months.

CONDITIONS:

Court costs
Defendant is to abide by all rules and recommendations of the supervising agent.
No Contact with ECK.  Forms of no contact include: in person, in writing, by telephone, by e-mail, or by any other forms of electronic communication, or through a third party intending to circumvent the no contact provision.

Court grants expungement upon successful completion of probation.

Court adjourned at 2:24 p.m.
Status hearing at 07-21-2015 02:00 pm

3:15 p.m.  No appearance by the defendant.  Attorney Barb Privat present.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by Atty Privat - needs more time to talk with defendant.  Court will set for status hearing on July 21, 2015 at 2:00p.m.

Court adjourned at 3:16 p.m.

4:05 p.m.  Defendant present in court with Atty Barb Privat.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by Atty Privat - defendant will waive the preliminary hearing.  Defendant concurs.

Court instructs the defendant regarding his right to a preliminary examination.  Defendant waives his right to a preliminary examination.  Court accepts the waiver of the prelim and binds the defendant over for trial.

State files an information with the court.  Attorney Privat and defendant acknowledge receipt of the information and waives any reading.  Atty Privat enters a plea of Not Guilty on behalf of the defendant.  Court will set for status hearing on June 15, 2015 at 3:00 p.m. 

Court adjourned at 4:07 p.m.
